meanings.definition: To dry (clothes or laundry) in a rough or harsh manner.
meanings.sent1: She roughdries her jeans by hanging them outside to air dry.
meanings.sent2: After washing, she roughdries her clothes on a clothesline instead of using a dryer.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally roughdries his favorite shirt, making it shrink a bit.
meanings.sent4: The sun roughdries the wet towels, turning them warm and fluffy.
meanings.sent5: The wind roughdries the laundry on the line, giving it a fresh scent.

meanings.definition: The act of drying clothes without using a dryer or iron.
meanings.sent1: Her preferred method of laundry care is roughdries on the line.
meanings.sent2: Roughdries can be a cost-effective way to dry clothes without using electricity.
meanings.sent3: The art of roughdries requires patience and good weather.
meanings.sent4: In a rush, she opted for roughdries, hoping the clothes would dry quickly.
meanings.sent5: The simplicity of roughdries appeals to those who enjoy natural methods of drying clothes.
